definition: most important element, the major party to a financial transaction at a stock exchange
details:
adjective
- most important element
= synonyms: main
noun
- the major party to a financial transaction at a stock exchange
= synonyms: dealer
- the educator who has executive authority for a school
= example: the educator who has executive authority for a school
= synonyms: head
- (criminal law) any person involved in a criminal offense, regardless of whether the person profits from such involvement
- an actor who plays a principal role
= synonyms: lead
- capital as contrasted with the income derived from it
= synonyms: corpus
- the original amount of a debt on which interest is calculated
